poker.evaluator

Class Evaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.evaluator.Evaluator

  • public class Evaluator
extends java.lang.Object
    Determines the winner of two poker hands.

    • Method Detail

      • compareHands

        public int compareHands(Hand h1,
               Hand h2)
        Evaluates two poker hands at showdown. If only one hand contains five cards, then that hand wins. If neither hand contains five cards they tie.
        Parameters:
        h1 - the first hand to be compared
        h2 - the second hand to be compared
        Returns:
        Returns 1 if h1 wins, 2 if h2 wins and 0 if the hands tie.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either hand is null

      • best5CardHand

        public Hand best5CardHand(Hand h)
        Returns the best 5-card poker hand you can make from a 7-card hand.
        Parameters:
        h - the 7-card hand to be evaluated
        Returns:
        the best 5-card hand you can make from a 7-card hand
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the hand is null

      • best5CardHandOutOfNcards

        private Hand best5CardHandOutOfNcards(Hand h,
                            int n)
        Returns the best 5-card poker hand you can make from a n-card hand.
        Parameters:
        h - the hand to be evaluated
        n - the number of cards in the hand
        Returns:
        the best 5-card hand you can make from the given hand
